tokenvisibility.settings.range-algorithm: Number of points to use when testing whether a token is within range of another. Also controls number of points for line-of-sight points algorithm. See https://github.com/caewok/fvtt-token-visibility#settings for a full explanation.
tokenvisibility.settings.range-points-fi: Token inset corners and center (5 points)
tokenvisibility.settings.range-points-3d: Test Bottom and Top Token Points
When applicable, use both the token elevation and the token line-of-sight to construct additional points for testing range and the line-of-sight points algorithm. (Requires Wall Height module.)
tokenvisibility.settings.range-distance-: Whether to measure token visibility range calculations in 3 dimensions, versus 2 (overhead view).
tokenvisibility.settings.los-algorithm.H: How to test a token's line-of-sight to another. Points will use the points from Range Algorithm. Area is generally more performance-intensive, but not always. See https://github.com/caewok/fvtt-token-visibility#settings for a full explanation.
tokenvisibility.settings.los-percent-are: Percentage of the token hit area that must be viewable to another token to be considered visible by that other token. If set to 0, then if any part of the token is viewable, it is considered visible.
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-algorithm: How to test whether a token has cover in relation to another. Algorithms loosely sorted from least to most performance-intensive. See https://github.com/caewok/fvtt-token-visibility#settings for a full explanation.
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-center-to: Center to corners of select target square
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-corner-to: Corner to corners of select target square (dnd5e DMG)
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-trigger-p: If greater than or equal to this percent of the corners or token area (depending on algorithm) is not viewable, the token will have low cover.
If greater than or equal to this percent of the corners or token area (depending on algorithm) is not viewable, the token will have medium cover.
If greater than or equal to this percent of the corner or token area (depending on algorithm) is not viewable, the token will have high cover.
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-trigger-c: When the line from one token center to another token center is blocked, use this cover type. (PF2e uses Medium, or Standard, cover.)
tokenvisibility.settings.midiqol-coverch: When rolling an attack in dnd5e with targeted tokens, should cover be applied automatically or require a confirmation dialog from the GM or user?
Only ask for cover attack workflow confirmation if the calculated cover varies from the current token status. Does nothing if cover attack workflow does not require confirmation.
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-combat-au: If in combat, when a user that owns the current combatant is targeting a token, apply cover effects to the targeted token based on cover from the current combatant.
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-chat-mess: When rolling an attack, test and display cover for targets in the chat. Currently only in dnd5e.
tokenvisibility.settings.menu-cover-effe: Configure the label, icon, and active effects for cover. Settings are stored per system. Separate settings are stored when the midi-qol module is active. If DFred's Convenient Effects module is active, those status effects will be used instead.
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-token-dea: Do dead or unconscious tokens grant cover? Set token to prone to give it half-cover when this setting is enabled.
String indicating where the hit points for a `token.actor` can be found. Required to use dead tokens for cover.
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-prone.Hin: If the dead/live token is prone and could otherwise be cover, should it be considered cover?
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-token-rid: If the Mounts and Riders of token (as per Rideable) should be considered as cover
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-token-liv: 'Cover': Token shape contributes to cover. 'Forced': Flat low cover for tokens; token shape not otherwise considered (dnd5e/pf2e). No cover: Tokens do not contribute to cover.
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-token-pro: String indicating the id for the token 'prone' status. If set, prone tokens will be considered half-height for all vision and cover calculations. Requires Wall Height module.
tokenvisibility.DrawingConfiguration.isH: For area algorithms, treat the space indicated by the drawing (including elevation) as a hole for tiles. Only applicable when Levels is active.
tokenvisibility.dnd5e.feats.cover.Name: Ignore certain levels of cover
tokenvisibility.dnd5e.feats.cover.Hint: Provided by feats and magic items.
